data.title: Hartford Judicial District: Office and Court Locations and Directions
data.text:
The Hartford Judicial District State’s Attorney’s Office serves the following cities and towns: Avon, Bloomfield, Canton, East Granby, East Hartford, East Windsor, Enfield, Farmington, Glastonbury, Granby, Hartford, Manchester, Marlborough, Simsbury, South Windsor, Suffield, West Hartford, Windsor, Windsor Locks.

The Office of the State’s Attorney, Judicial District of Hartford

Also referred to as "Part A" court, this Office handles more serious criminal cases (crimes classified under state law as class A or class B felony offenses) from all communities in the Judicial District of Hartford.

Sharmese L. Walcott

State’s Attorney

Robert Diaz Supervisory Assistant State’s Attorney

Richard J. Rubino Supervisory Assistant State’s Attorney

Office of the State’s Attorney

Judicial District of Hartford

101 Lafayette Street

Hartford, CT 06106

Phone: (860) 566-3190

Fax: (860) 566-2812

Email: conndcj@ct.gov

Map of Hartford Superior Court

Geographical Area No. 14, Hartford

Also referred to as "Part B" Court, this Office primarily handles cases involving those crimes classified under state law as class C, class D or class E felony offenses as well as all misdemeanor offenses and infractions, including motor vehicle offenses, occurring in Avon, Bloomfield, Canton, Farmington, Hartford and West Hartford.

Carl R. Ajello III Supervisory Assistant State’s Attorney

Edward R. Azzaro

Supervisory Assistant State’s Attorney

State’s Attorney's Office - G.A. No. 14

101 Lafayette Street

Hartford, CT 06106

Phone: (860) 566-5996

Fax: (860) 566-1458

Email: conndcj@ct.gov

Map of Hartford Superior Court

Geographical Area No. 12, Manchester

Also referred to as "Part B" Court, this Office primarily handles cases involving those crimes classified under state law as class C, class D or class E felony offenses as well as all misdemeanor offenses and infractions, including motor vehicle offenses, occurring in East Hartford, Glastonbury, Manchester, Marlborough and South Windsor.

Anthony Bochicchio

Supervisory Assistant State’s Attorney

410 Center Street

Manchester, CT 06040

Map of Manchester Superior Court

Community Court, Hartford

80 Washington Street

Hartford, CT 06106

Phone: (860) 756-7815

Fax: (860) 756-7812

Email: conndcj@ct.gov

Map of Hartford Community Court

Juvenile Matters Court

In Connecticut, the Superior Court for Juvenile Matters has jurisdiction over juveniles accused of delinquent acts. Delinquents are persons who, prior to their 18th birthdays, have violated or attempted to violate any state law, order of the Superior Court, or any local or municipal ordinance.

The purpose of Juvenile Court is to rehabilitate more than punish. Although the same elements of the criminal statutes apply to both adults and juveniles, in most cases juveniles are subject to different procedures and sanctions than adults. The exception to the above involves the transfer of juveniles to the adult criminal court for serious offenses specified by law. Furthermore, juveniles are required to appear at the appropriate juvenile court based on where they live, rather than the court where the delinquent act occurred.

Juvenile Matters Courts are located in 11 municipalities and include the following towns and cities:

Bridgeport
